question: Light of energy E falls normally on a metal of work function $\frac{E}{3}$. The kinetic energies (K) of the photo electrons are
explanation: Maximum kinetic energy $K_{max} = E - \Phi = E - E/3 = 2E/3$.
Photoelectrons can have any kinetic energy from 0 up to $K_{max}$ due to internal collisions.
